text:
[STRAUSS, "ALSO SPRACH
 ZARATHUSTRA"]

CHARLES M. VEST: A
web-based program

that will provide free access to
primary materials for virtually
every course.
PROF.

GILBERT STRANG: We have
some number of equations,
say n equations and n unknown.
PROF.

ESTHER DUFLO: Both
the placebo and people

who got the pill, if there
were not an immediate--
PROF.
MICHEL DEGRAFF, PROF.

CATHY DRENNAN: There
are some small--
PROF.

SRINI DEVADAS:
What's a natural--

what's a reasonable way
of perceiving things?
Like, what's a reasonable--
[RECORD SCRATCH]
[STRAUSS, "BLUE DANUBE"]

MARIA: I live in
Sao Paulo, Brazil,
where I go to medical school.

And I started using OCW
when I was 15 I guess.

EMMANUEL: I discovered OCW on
YouTube about five years ago.

JAE-MIN: I absolutely
love MIT OpenCourseWare.

It lowered the bar of entering
a new learning territory for me.

And it ultimately allowed me
to carve out a unique career
pathway.

MICHAEL: During the COVID-19
pandemic, I was unemployed.

I started as a poet and
a painter and a sculptor.

I made the transition to working
for a financial technology
startup.

MARIA: OCW allowed me to
gain a more solid grasp
on the basic sciences.

EMMANUEL: It's helped me
learn about the things I love

learning about-- human
behavioral sciences,
psychology--
MICHAEL: Programming and Python.

JAE-MIN: Thermodynamics,
just absolutely fascinating.

EMMANUEL: Artificial
intelligence.

JAE-MIN: Then you should also
start your learning journey
with MIT OpenCourseWare.

MARIA: And I think we
probably should bring one more

friend for the ride so we
can reach 10 million soon.

[STRAUSS, "ALSO SPRACH
 ZARATHUSTRA"]

[JON GEGELMAN, "OUTER SPACE
 CHURCH"]
